GapFillInput.Title: Quantifiers: some / a few / a lot of / not many / not much / not enough / no / too many
GapFillInput.Instruction: Type a quantifier (e.g. some, a few, a lot of etc.) into each gap. There may be more than one correct answer.

Content.Question:
According to a recent survey, Edinburgh is one of the best places to live in the UK. People from the city tell us why:
1. ‘There's some|a lot of beautiful scenery nearby.'
2. ‘There isn't much|a lot of traffic or pollution; a lot of|many
people ride bicycles around the city.'
3. ‘There are a few|some world famous attractions like the
Castle, the Royal Mile and the National Gallery.'
4. ‘People don't have many|a lot of health problems.'
5. ‘There are no ugly skyscrapers.'
6. ‘There are a lot of good shops and cafés.'
7. ‘Once a year we have the Edinburgh Festival. The only problem is that there are too many plays and concerts to go to and not enough time to do everything.'
